Text_Numeracy: A few years back, I suffered from a severe kidney stone attack, and had to go to the E.R. for treatment. I explained to the doctors what was happening, and that the pain I was having was the result of burst cysts. They didn't believe me. I had to convince these doctors to give me a pelvic ultrasound, and of course they found ALL the cysts. They gave me an opioid prescription that was unnecessary (I didn't take them) and sent me on my way. I began actively monitoring my body and the things I was taking. When that test showed an even greater increase in creatinine levels and I was taken off Metformin, I was told everything would be fine and I should get my bloodwork done again in 6 months.
